Steps to reproduce
------------------



```powershell
Set-Content -Path .\test.txt -Value 'test'
Set-Content -Path .\test.txt -Value 'test2' -Stream 'foo'
$session = New-PSSession -VMName myVm #supply valid credentials to connect to remote when prompted
Copy-Item -ToSession $session -Path .\test.txt -Destination C:\Data\Shared\test.xtx
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Copy should work
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Copy-Item : Cannot bind parameter 'Encoding'. Cannot convert the "Byte" value of type "System.String" to type
"System.Text.Encoding".
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item -ToSession  $s -Path C:\Windows\System32\test.txt -Destinat ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Write-Error], ParameterBindingException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.ParameterBindingException,PSCopyFileAlternateStreamToRemote
   Session

Copy-Item : Failed to copy file C:\Windows\System32\test.txt to remote target destination.
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item -ToSession  $s -Path C:\Windows\System32\test.txt -Destinat ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : WriteError: (C:\Windows\System32\test.txt:String) [Copy-Item], IOException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CopyError,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CopyItemCommand
```

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
A workaround is to delete the alternate data streams: `Get-Item .\test.txt -Stream * | Where-Object {$_.stream -ne ':$DATA'} | %{Remove-Item $_.Filename -Stream $_.Stream}`

The customer that reported this to me reports that `unblock-file` also resolves the issue, but results may vary.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The cause of the error is on this line:  https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/System.Management.Automation/namespaces/FileSystemProvider.cs#L9027

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
There are 2 other instances that use `-Encoding Byte`:

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/25dbc68b8e50b9b6706cec2a7fe3bccfe7736e04/src/System.Management.Automation/namespaces/FileSystemProvider.cs#L9391

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/25dbc68b8e50b9b6706cec2a7fe3bccfe7736e04/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/hostifaces/HostUtilities.cs#L930

All 3 of these need to include a version check for Core and use `-AsByteStream`. I'm not sure if these scripts are ever subject to strict mode. If they are, testing for `$IsCoreCLR` or `$PSVersionTable.PSEdition -eq 'Core'` wont work. This might, though: `$PSVersionTable.ContainsValue('Core')`

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: PSEdition is also core for NanoServer and prior to 1709 the version of PowerShell was Windows PowerShell Core not PowerShell Core.  We will have to check the version unless we want to just count the older versions of nano obsolete.

title: Copy-Item -ToSession when the destination has an alternate data stream fails
